meanings.definition: Covered with or smelling of mold
meanings.sent1: The old books in the basement were getting mouldier by the day.
meanings.sent2: The bread left out for too long started to get mouldier and mouldier.
meanings.sent3: The forgotten sandwich in the lunchbox became mouldier than a science experiment.
meanings.sent4: The damp, dark cellar was filled with boxes of mouldier memories.
meanings.sent5: The musty smell in the attic grew mouldier with each passing year.

meanings.sent1: Leaving food out in the open makes it mouldier faster.
meanings.sent2: The damp clothes in the laundry basket were getting mouldier.
meanings.sent3: The abandoned house had a mouldier atmosphere than a haunted mansion.
meanings.sent4: The neglected fruit bowl was a mouldier sight than expected.
meanings.sent5: The wet towel left on the floor became mouldier with each passing hour.

meanings.sent1: The bread left on the counter was mouldier than the one in the fridge.
meanings.sent2: The old cheese was mouldier than the fresh batch.
meanings.sent3: The forgotten leftovers in the fridge were mouldier than a science experiment gone wrong.
meanings.sent4: The basement corner was mouldier than the rest of the room.
meanings.sent5: The abandoned house was mouldier than any other on the block.
